definition: to defend sb (a relative, friend or oneself) despite knowing that that person is in the wrong

sentences.english: If Fred didn't leave till five o'clock, he can't be home yet.
sentences.chinese: 如果弗雷德五點鐘以後走護短，現在還不可能到家。

sentences.english: May justify the upgrade switch be very difficult.
sentences.chinese: 護短是交換機的升級可能會非常困難。

definition: open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
to wish for the whole world to be in chaos (idiom)
pinyin: wei2 kong3 tian1 xia4 bu4 luan4

definition: old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
to damage the country and cause suffering to the people (idiom)
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
